qas.question: What is the Greek term for canon?
What is the Hebrew term for canon?
What is the Arabic term meaning canon?
What is the common definition of the word canon as it appears in Greek, Arabic and Hebrew?
Which English term is derived from the same root as the Greek, Arabic and Hebrew words for canon?
What is kanon the Hebrew word for?
What is Kaneh the Greek word for?

context: Greek <a0_0>kanon<a0_0/> / Ancient Greek: κανών, Arabic <a2_0>Qanun<a2_0/> / قانون, Hebrew <a1_0>kaneh<a1_0/> / קנה, "straight"; a rule, code, standard, or measure; the root meaning in all these languages is "<a3_0><b5_0><b6_0>reed<b6_0/><b5_0/><a3_0/>" (cf. the Romance-language ancestors of the English word "<a4_0>cane<a4_0/>").
